snippet: Particularly in the last two years of his term, Mitt Romney was often missing from Massachusetts on personal trips or political ones unrelated to his job.
abstract: Mitt Romney, particularly in the last two years of his term as governor of Massachusetts, was often out of state on personal trips or to lay groundwork for his presidential ambitions in the 2008 election, two years after he left office; no one points to any lapses from his absences, but some former constituents, particularly Democrats, say his travels suggest he was more interested in attaining the governor's post than in doing the job.
lead_paragraph: Particularly in the last two years of his term, Mitt Romney was often missing from Massachusetts on personal trips or political ones unrelated to his job.

headline.seo: Mitt Romney Often Away When He Was Governor
headline.main: As Massachusetts Governor, Romney Was Often Away
headline.print_headline: As Massachusetts Governor, Romney Was Often Away
